text: vice-president CIO chief innovation
officer for st. Louis University so we
did a pilot in spring where we put in 20
Amazon echo and 20 competitor devices to
say what's the right virtual assistant
technology to provide to our students
the Amazon echo was was favored
significantly over over the competitor
device and so we said okay now let's
really go all-in and let's put these in
every single room and then we said
explore use the device see what you
think we didn't have a skill it was just
the device and so through that we did a
survey at the end of the process and and
found out how students were using device
what they liked what they didn't like
working with Alexis for business team
allowed us to move through this process
quickly and efficiently all the way from
the beginning of the process from
concept to completion the Alexis for
business team and overall AWS wisdom was
very supportive and helped us every step
of the way this is truly a foundation
for us that we plan on building on over
the next several years we started with
the student experience but next we're
going to be looking at the faculty
experience the staff experience so for
us this is a very strategic technology
that we feel has as a significant
potential in the future around
productivity and helping our students
staff faculty and others be productive
you
